name: TicTacToe Prototype in C!
description:
Why to recreate TicTacToe?

Created in less than 3 hours in the good and old C programming language, this game is a prototype for one of the courses I'm facing at the college. The professor told us to use OpenGL (Difficult? As f**k), but I implemented ir first using the Raylib library in order to write all the game logic before applying in OpenGL.

Simple and minimalist:

There's nothing here that shouldn't be: the game has only one menu with all information. The art is made using Raylib functions, but (I promise) will be updated as soon as possible to something more beautiful. 

How to play?

In order to place your X or O on the board you only need to click with the left mouse key. Simple and efficient. The turn is updated automatically, so the second player can play it as well.

Can I replay?

Of course! After a winning / tie you'll be able to press SPACE and reset the game.
